news_header: Hurricane Helene is the second deadliest hurricane to hit the continental U.S. in the last 50 years, causing at least 236 deaths across six states.
news_text: Hurricane Helene has resulted in at least 236 fatalities across six states, with North Carolina reporting the highest number of deaths at 117, followed by South Carolina with 48. It is the second deadliest hurricane in the continental U.S. in the past 50 years, surpassed only by Hurricane Katrina in 2005, which caused 1,833 deaths. Meanwhile, Hurricane Milton is approaching Florida, having intensified to a Category 5 storm. President Joe Biden has urged residents to evacuate, warning that it could be the worst natural disaster to strike Florida in a century.
